thread.title: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, Oct. 9
thread.title_full: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, Oct. 9

title: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, Oct. 9
text:
Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, Oct. 9 By Richard Eng 
Post Time 1 p.m. Race 1 – 1 mile, Purse $16,000, Claiming $8,000, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up2 Midnight Lady – I thought trainer Julio Canani just got suspended for a year by the Santa Anita stewards; maybe there is a stay until he can appeal the ruling against him.1 Sheza Eyeopener – Has been claimed twice in a row, which I guess is a good thing; Michael Pender is a dependable trainer, so if this mare feels good, she’ll run good.Long Shot – 3 Mudge Race 2 – 1 1/8th miles, Purse $53,000, Optional claiming $40,000, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up5 Never Ends – This is the longer odds price of the uncoupled entry from the maestro Jerry Hollendorfer; interesting that Martin Garcia replaces Rafael Bejarano here.4 Sarahline – This is the other half of the Jerry Hollendorfer uncoupled entry; ran evenly in this same class while favored at Los Alamitos, that’s not necessarily good.Long Shot – 1 Yana Race 3 – 1 mile (turf, rail at 30 feet), Purse $36,000, Claiming $40,000, Fillies, 3-year-olds3 True History – Trainer Ron Ellis knows when to hold them, knows when to fold them; this one takes a subtle class drop to a spot where she should be very dangerous. 2 Evo Campo – She has shown two distinctively differently running styles in recent races; ran on the lead in last, while rallied in two prior starts, we’ll see.Long Shot – 1 Revenue Virginius Race 4 – 5 ½ furlongs, Purse $32,000, Maiden claiming $75,000, 2-year-olds7 Classico – Don’t really trust the ones with experience, so I’ll let Rafael Bejarano and his agent do the handicapping; this is a FTS from the Doug O’Neill barn.6 Knight of Drama – Ran creditably in the Barretts Juvenile at a juicy 93/1 odds; obviously gets big time class relief tonight, but a repeat races gives him a chance.Long Shot – 5 Ossetra Race 5 – 6 ½ furlongs (turf, rail at 30 feet), Purse $29,000, Claiming $25,000, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up8 Frandontjudge – If you have followed me over the years you know how much I like cutback horses; this one is from Jerry Hollendorfer and draws a favorable wide post.5 Aunty Pearl – Has a decent grass resume, certainly good enough to battle this kind of class; trainer Bill Spawr is one I respect an awful lot whomever he starts. Long Shot – 4 An Unusual Group Race 6 – 1 1/16th miles, Purse $19,000, Claiming $16,000, 3-year-olds and up1 Blackford – Should get a beautiful trip from the rail in this 2-turn route; has enough back class where he should be able to coast by in the long stretch run. 4 Ice Cream Truck – Trainer A. C. Avila has found out why this horse has only two wins from 38 starts; he is camera shy, but still productive with eight seconds.Long Shot – 5 A Colt Following Race 7 – 1 1/8th miles (turf, rail at 30 feet), Purse $55,000, Optional claiming $62,500, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up5 Last Kiss – Interesting Brazilian import makes her U.S. debut tonight; gets to race first time with Lasix and jockey James Graham gets a live shot from Neil Drysdale.1 Bottle Blonde – Despite winning two races in a row, gets her third different jockey in a row; her last winning jockey Flavien Prat is injured so it’s an obvious change.Long Shot – 7 Royal Temptress Race 8 – 6 furlongs, Purse $17,000, Maiden claiming $20,000, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up1 Stellata – This is strictly a leap of faith in Rafael Bejarano and his agent; when a top jock stays for the finale in a cheap race, I suspect the horse is very live.11 Canadian Exchange – Claimed by trainer Peter Miller and put right back into the same class; not often you see a top trainer take a horse out of a $20K maiden claimer.Long Shot – 3 Just Bookin Best Bet - 1 Blackford (race 6)Santa Anita Thursday - Picks/Winners/Mutuels, 15/3/$19.60; Long Shots, 8/2/$27.40; Best Bet, 1/0/$0Santa Anita Totals - 119/27/$161.20; Long Shots, 60/13/$183.60; Best Bets, 5/2/$5.60SIMULCAST PLAY OF THE DAY - #5 Ageless (3/1) in race 9 at Keeneland. For scoring purposes, we'll make a hypothetical $2 win, place and show bet, $6 total. On Thursday, Rumble Doll won at Belmont Park paying $4.80 to win, 43.00 to place and $2.40 to show. Stats - 149/99/$745.20; Follow him on Twitter: @richeng4propick
